intro: Hoarea longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Hoarea longiflora typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is known for its rich biodiversity.
